revised_title: Classification and Observations of Glossopora Species
tldr: Dr. Johnson observes and classifies the Hirudo complanata and Hirudo stagnalis into a new genus called Glossopora due to their distinct features. He also describes two species within this genus, Glossopora tuberculata and Glossopora punctata. He discusses their anatomy, reproduction, and feeding habits, and refutes the idea that they can reproduce when cut or divided.
